timeline.bodyText: @pollend Is this too much overhead keeping the vectors? Should I instead use just 4 plain integers?
timeline.author: skaldarnar

timeline.bodyText: @pollend Should we compute the bounding rectangle every time something changes, or just when it is requested (lazy)? I've prepared to do the latter, not fully implemented yet, though.
timeline.author: skaldarnar

replies.bodyText: I would just update the bounds if it changes. you still end up needing to recalculate it for most cases.  when you update min you only need to update the minimum of the bounds and the same for max. its probably more expensive to check if its dirty and then try update both the bounds.
replies.author: pollend

replies.bodyText: I would expect this to be used sufficiently rarely that just not cacheing at all would be best.
replies.author: 4Denthusiast
